page.title: Help Center
page.subtitle: How can we help you today?

topic1.name: Managing Projects
topic1.description: Learn how to create, view, edit, and delete your projects.
topic1.step3: Fill in the details (name, description, dates, status, tags, etc.).
topic1.step4: To view details, click "View Details" on an existing project.
topic1.step5: Inside the details, use the buttons to Edit or Delete the project.

topic2.name: Managing Collaborators
topic2.description: Invite, remove, and view collaborator profiles. Accept or decline invitations.
topic2.step2: To invite, click "Invite Collaborator" and enter the email.
topic2.step3: To remove, find the collaborator and click the trash icon (confirmation will be requested).
topic2.step4: To view the profile, click the eye icon.
topic2.step5: In the "Received Invitations" section, click "Accept" or "Decline".

topic3.name: Using Comments
topic3.description: How to add, assign, reply, edit, archive, and manage comments/tasks.
topic3.step2: Click "Add Comment" to create a new one.
topic3.step3: Select the project, write the comment, and optionally assign it to a collaborator.
topic3.step4: Use the status selector to update progress.
topic3.step5: Use the action menu (...) to Edit or Archive.
topic3.step6: Click the reply button to view/add replies.
topic3.step7: Access "Archived Comments" to view or restore comments.

topic4.name: Managing Tags
topic4.description: Create, edit, and delete tags to organize your projects and comments.
topic4.step2: Click "Add Tag" to create a new tag with name, description, and color.
topic4.step3: Use the Edit (pencil) or Delete (trash) buttons on each listed tag.

topic5.name: Settings and Profile
topic5.description: How to update your profile, manage billing, and set preferences.
topic5.step1: Go to "Settings" to manage account details, plans and billing, language/currency options, and email notification preferences.
topic5.step2: Go to "Profile" to update your avatar, name, bio, social links, and personal tags (hobbies, skills, education).

topic6.name: Navigation and Appearance
topic6.description: How to use the sidebar, bottom navigation (mobile), and switch themes.
topic6.step1: Use the sidebar (desktop) or bottom navigation bar (mobile) to access different sections.
topic6.step2: Click the sun/moon icon in the header to switch between light and dark modes.

topic7.name: Notifications
topic7.description: How to view and manage your notifications.
topic7.step1: Click the bell icon in the header to see recent notifications.
topic7.step2: Click "View all notifications" to go to the full page.
topic7.step3: On the notifications page, navigate through months using the arrows.

faq1.question: How do I change my password?
faq1.answer: Go to Settings > Account. Click the "Change Password" button and follow the instructions, or use the "Forgot? Send Reset Link" to reset via email.

faq2.question: Can I use Projectude offline?
faq2.answer: Projectude is a web application and requires an active internet connection for real-time access and updates.

faq3.question: What happens if I need more features than the Free plan offers?
faq3.answer: The Free plan has limitations, such as not allowing project creation and management. For full access, consider the Premium plan. Details and subscription options (monthly, yearly, biannual) are available in Settings > Plan & Billing.

faq4.question: How is my data protected?
faq4.answer: We prioritize data security by using standard encryption practices for data in transit and at rest. Specific details depend on the final implementation.

faq5.question: Is there a mobile app?
faq5.answer: Currently, Projectude is optimized for web browsers on desktops and mobile devices (with responsive layout and bottom navigation bar). A dedicated mobile app is not available at this time.

faq6.question: How do collaborator invitations work?
faq6.answer: Inviting a collaborator allows you to add them to your projects. They will receive an email invitation and, if accepted, will appear in your list of collaborators ready to be assigned to specific projects.

faq7.question: What is the "Shared With Me" section for?
faq7.answer: This section lists projects created by other users who have added you as a collaborator. You can view the details of these projects but cannot edit or delete them directly from this section.

terms-condition.introText: By accessing and using the Projectude platform (www.projectude.com), you agree to the terms and conditions described below. If you do not agree with these terms, we recommend that you do not use our services.
terms-condition.section1Text: Projectude is an online tool for project management, team collaboration, and task organization, aimed at individual users and professional teams. The platform offers features such as:
terms-condition.section2Text1: To use the platform, the user must create an account providing truthful and up-to-date information. The user is responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of their login credentials and for all activities performed on their account.
terms-condition.section2Item1: Use false data or third-party information;
terms-condition.section2Item2: Share login and password with others;
terms-condition.section2Item3: Use the account for illegal or unauthorized purposes.
terms-condition.section3Text1: Projectude offers two types of plans:
terms-condition.section3Item1: Free Plan: Free access with limited features.
terms-condition.section3Item2: Premium Plan: Full access with monthly, annual, or biannual payments. Prices vary based on the user’s location (R$, US$, €), with automatic recurring billing according to the selected option.
terms-condition.section3Text2: All prices and plans are displayed according to the user's geographic location, detected automatically. Currency and prices cannot be changed manually.
terms-condition.section3Text3: Cancellations can be made at any time, and Premium access will remain active until the end of the paid period.
terms-condition.section4Text1: The user is responsible for all content entered, including:
terms-condition.section4Text2: Projectude is not responsible for lost or improperly shared data between users.
terms-condition.section5Text: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate accounts that violate these terms or that use the platform in an abusive, fraudulent manner or in a way that compromises the system or other users.
terms-condition.section6Text: Use of the platform is subject to our Privacy Policy, which describes how data is collected, stored, and used. The user agrees to the processing of their data in accordance with this policy.
terms-condition.section7Text: All platform content, including text, layout, design, features, logo, and the Projectude brand, is protected by copyright and may not be copied, reproduced, or used without express authorization.
terms-condition.section8Text: Projectude may modify these Terms of Use at any time. Users will be notified by email or via notification within the platform. Continued use of the service after an update implies acceptance of the new terms.
terms-condition.section9Text: For questions, technical support, or suggestions, users can access the Help Center within the platform or contact us at: help@projectude.com
terms-condition.section10Text: These terms are governed by the laws of Brazil. The court of Palmas/TO is elected to settle any disputes arising from this agreement.

cookies-policy.title: Projectude Cookie Policy
cookies-policy.intro: This Cookie Policy explains how the Projectude Platform uses cookies and similar technologies to recognize you when you visit our site (www.projectude.com). It details what cookies are, why we use them, and how you can control them.
cookies-policy.section1Text: Cookies are small text files stored in your browser or device when you visit a website. They serve to recognize your preferences, enhance your browsing experience, and collect analytical information.
cookies-policy.strictlyNecessaryText: These cookies are essential for the platform to function and cannot be disabled. They are used, for example, to:
cookies-policy.strictlyNecessaryItem1: Keep you logged into your account
cookies-policy.performanceText: Help us understand how users interact with Projectude, allowing us to:
cookies-policy.performanceExample: Example: we use tools like Google Analytics with IP anonymization.
cookies-policy.functionalityText: Allow the platform to remember your choices and personalize your experience, such as:
cookies-policy.marketingItem1: Show personalized communications about updates or plans
cookies-policy.marketingItem2: Measure interaction with promotional campaigns (with your consent)
cookies-policy.managementText: You can control and/or delete cookies at any time. To do so:
cookies-policy.managementItem1: Browser Settings: Adjust cookie permissions, block or delete saved cookies.
cookies-policy.managementItem2: Consent Banner: Upon first access, you may accept or decline categories of cookies (except essential ones).
cookies-policy.managementItem3: “Manage Cookies” Button: Available in the platform footer to change preferences at any time.
cookies-policy.thirdPartyText: We may use third-party service cookies (e.g., Stripe, Firebase, Google) for authentication, payments, or analytics. These cookies are subject to the respective providers' privacy policies.
cookies-policy.changesText: This Cookie Policy may be modified periodically to reflect changes in legislation or the platform itself. The updated version will always be published at: www.projectude.com/cookies
cookies-policy.contactText: If you have any questions or requests regarding the use of cookies, please contact our team:
cookies-policy.consentText: By continuing to use Projectude after viewing the cookie notice, you agree to the use as described in this policy.

privacy-police.title: Projectude Platform Privacy Policy
privacy-police.intro: Your privacy is important to us. This Privacy Policy describes how we collect, use, store, and protect your personal data when you use the Projectude platform, accessible at www.projectude.com.
privacy-police.section1Text: When using Projectude, we may collect the following data:
privacy-police.section1_2Item1: Actions performed on the platform (e.g., project creation, comments, invitations)
privacy-police.section1_2Item2: IP address, browser type, and device
privacy-police.section1_3Item1: Projects and credentials entered by users
privacy-police.section2Item1: Enable the full functionality of the platform
privacy-police.section3Text: Your data is not sold to third parties. We may share information:
privacy-police.section3Item1: With payment service providers (e.g., credit card gateways)
privacy-police.section3Item2: To comply with legal, judicial, or regulatory obligations
privacy-police.section3Item3: With authorized collaborators in the projects you participate in
privacy-police.section4Text: We adopt technical and organizational measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, misuse, alteration, or destruction.
privacy-police.section4Item3: Controlled data access by the technical team
privacy-police.section5Text: Your data will be retained as long as your account is active or as necessary to fulfill the purposes described. You may request the deletion of your account and data at any time.
privacy-police.section6Item1: Access the data we have about you
privacy-police.section6Note: Requests must be made via email: help@projectude.com
privacy-police.section7Text: We use cookies and similar technologies to:
privacy-police.section7Note: You can control the use of cookies in your browser settings.
privacy-police.section8Text: This policy may be updated periodically. Users will be notified via the Help Center or email. We recommend reviewing this page regularly.
privacy-police.section9Text: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us:
privacy-police.finalConsent: By using Projectude, you agree to this Privacy Policy.
